title: Beautiful Hotel -
text:
This hotel is small but beautiful. Marble floors. Lots of woodwork framing on the walls, paintings and drawings in hardwood frames, glazed terracotta tiles on the hall and room floors (Instead of the usual tacky carpets), a fully functional cage elevator, wallpapered hallways and rooms, comfortable beds, well maintained almost-antique furniture, generously sized rooms and bathrooms (this being Europe).
This is a family owned hotel, it would seem they take pride in it and want to give it an ambiance of times gone by. For me, it works.
That said, it's also quite modern, with all the conveniences. Small bar, pretty well stocked and offering MUCH more than pretzels to much on while enjoying a beer, wine or drink. Small but comfortable and yes, elegant, sitting rome off the bar.
Breakfast is inexpensive, plentiful and varied. Quiche, scrambeld eggs, ham, fruits breads, juices, milk and mineral water. They offer American and that delicious espresso Italian coffee. The staff can be a bit shy if their English isn't very good. Try speaking Italian to them, and watch their warm nature come out. but whether you do or don't, they're pleasant, helpful and polite. Erver at the front desk stands out. Efficient, helpful, respectful and outgoing (He speaks excellent, though slightly accented, English.) and with a witty, wry sense of humor, if he gauges you'd be appreciative of it.
In short, if I'm in Rome, this is my hotel.
